entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Revival and Rehabilitation Scheme for Defunct MSMEs and Cashew Processing Units
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Revival and Rehabilitation Scheme for Defunct MSMEs and Cashew Processing Units" envisages supporting defunct MSMEs in the manufacturing sector including cashew processing units through assistance in the form of capital grants and working capital incentives.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Pre-Matric Scholarships to the Children of Those Engaged in Occupations Involving Cleaning and Prone to Health Hazards
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to children whose parents/guardians belong to one of the following categories, to pursue Pre-Matric education: Tanners, Flayers, Waste Pickers and Persons who are either presently engaged in Manual Scavenging.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Purchase of Fuel (Petrol) to the Fishermen for Operation of Out Board Motors
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Financial Assistance for Purchase of Fuel (Petrol) to the Fishermen for Operation of Out Board Motors” is a scheme by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. Through this scheme, a subsidy of ₹30 per Litre on a maximum consumption of 1700 Litre of Petrol is provided to fishermen.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Purchase Outboard Motor of 2HP to 5 HP for Fitting to the Fishing Canoe
fields.briefDescription: “Financial Assistance to Purchase Outboard Motor of 2HP to 5 HP for Fitting to the Fishing Canoe” is a scheme by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. This Scheme has been introduced to grant financial assistance in the form of a subsidy on the purchase of an outboard motor of 2HP to 5HP.

fields.schemeName: Scheme to Provide Financial Assistance to the Publishers for Publishing Books of Goan Authors
fields.briefDescription: "Scheme to Provide Financial Assistance to the Publishers for Publishing Books of Goan Authors"  by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa, has been designed to promote Goan publishers to provide them with financial support for the publication of books.

fields.schemeName: Promotion of Energy Audit and Conservation of Energy (PEACE): Training Programme
fields.briefDescription: "Promotion of Energy Audit and Conservation of Energy (PEACE): Training Programme" is introduced to enable MSMEs to establish the systems and processes necessary to improve energy performance, and energy efficiency, and help reduce energy consumption and costs.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Incentive to the Family having One Girl/Two Girl Children and Parents who have undergone Family Planning
fields.briefDescription: This scheme aims to create awareness among parents about the desirability of the girl child and elevate the status of the girl child in the family. The scheme provides an amount of ₹30,000/- deposited in the name of the girl child, and in the case of two girl children, ₹15,000/- is deposited.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Central Sector Scheme of National Fellowship for Providing Fellowship to Scheduled Caste Students to Pursue M.Phil. & PhD
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides opportunities to Scheduled Castes students to pursue higher education leading to M.Phil/Ph.D degrees in Sciences, Humanities and Social Science streams. The objective of the scheme is to provide fellowships in the form of financial assistance to SC students.

fields.schemeName: Indian Community Welfare Fund
fields.briefDescription: A scheme by Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) for the welfare of Overseas Indians; assisting them in distress situations. ICWF has also been a critical support in emergency evacuation of Indian nationals from conflict zones, countries affected by natural disasters and other challenging situations.

fields.schemeName: Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana aims to translate the comprehensive vision of Mahatma Gandhi about an ideal Indian village into reality, keeping in view the present context. Each Member of Parliament adopts a Gram Panchayat and guides its holistic progress giving importance to social development.

fields.schemeName: Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural Research
fields.briefDescription: The Scheme has been introduced to invigorate and revitalize the various institutions under the Ministry of Culture and other identified cultural institutions in the country, by encouraging Fellows/academicians to affiliate themselves with these institutions to work on projects of mutual interest.

fields.schemeName: Fellowship For Superannuated Faculty Members
fields.briefDescription: The "Fellowship for Superannuated Faculty Members" scheme is a fellowship scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education to provide opportunities to superannuated faculty members of Universities/Institutes/Colleges, hereinafter “Institutions” to pursue research.

fields.schemeName: Indo-French Visiting/Mobility Programme for Women in Science
fields.briefDescription: This programme will encourage women candidates to work with the Indian/French scientific communities with an aim to accelerate their talented instincts towards carrying out advanced studies and research in the frontier areas of Science & Technology.

fields.schemeName: VAIshwik BHArtiya Vaigyanik (VAIBHAV) Fellowship
fields.briefDescription:
VAIBHAV Fellowship envisages collaboration between scientists of Indian Diaspora with
Indian Higher Educational Institutions/Universities/Public Funded Scientific
Institutions. Fellow would identify an Indian Institution for collaboration &
may spend upto two months in a year for a max. of 3 years.

fields.schemeName: AICTE-IDEA (Idea Development, Evaluation & Application) LAB SCHEME
fields.briefDescription: Through Idea Lab Scheme, AICTE will be setting up Idea Labs in AICTE approved institutions to encourage students for application of science, technology engineering and mathematics (STEM) fundamentals towards enhanced hands-on experience, learning by doing and even product visualization.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance on Death/Disablement of Beneficiary (CBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance will be provided to registered construction workers with full or 50% disability due to an accident. The financial assistance will also be provided to the widowed dependents of registered male construction workers for any reason of death.

fields.schemeName: MMKY-Financial Assistance for New Boat, Engine, and Net
fields.briefDescription: The State plan scheme “MMKY-Financial Assistance for New Boat, Engine, and Net” was launched by the Fisheries & Animal Resources Development Department, Government of Odisha in order to increase the marine fish production and to enhance incomes and livelihoods of the marine fishers.

fields.schemeName: Balika Samrithi Yojana
fields.briefDescription: “Balika Samrithi Yojana” by the Dept of Women & Child Development, Govt of Pondicherry was introduced to improve the status of the girl child and provide nutritious food to the girl child. Financial assistance of ₹500 in the form of a National Savings Certificate is provided to lactating mothers.

fields.schemeName: AICTE-Margdarshan scheme
fields.briefDescription: Margdarshan Initiative has been introduced by All India Council for Technical Education in 2018 for facilitating the technical institutes in order to improve the quality of technical education as a whole through accreditation by providing access to the facilities available in host institute.

fields.schemeName: Mahila Samman Savings Certificate
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Mahila Samman Savings Certificate” was launched by the Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance to provide financial security to every girl and woman in India.

fields.schemeName: Death Benefit (A.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance shall be given to the nominees/dependents of a registered worker towards death benefit, in case of normal death or due to an accident during the course of employment.

fields.schemeName: Vegetable Development Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to promote vegetable production through HYV Seeds/ Hybrids/ Improved/ Open Pollinated seedlings, including assistance to farmers.

fields.schemeName: Free Distribution of Blankets and Chappals to Senior Citizen
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Free Distribution of Blankets and Chappals to Senior Citizen" was launched by the Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry. The objective of this scheme is to enable the poor senior citizens, aged 60 years and above and residing in Puducherry, to receive blankets and chappals.

fields.schemeName: Cash Award (A.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: Cash awards shall be given to the three male & three female children of the registered construction workers in each district to those students who score 75% or above, 65% or less than 75%, and 55% or less than 65% mark in HSLC, AHM and H.S. examinations.

fields.schemeName: Swami Vivekananda Nishakta Swavlamban Protsahan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: “Swami Vivekananda Nishakta Swavlamban Protsahan Yojana ” is a Social Security Scheme by the Department of Women, Child Development & Social Security, Government of Jharkhand. The aim of the scheme is to provide social security to differently abled people aged five(5) years and above.

fields.schemeName: State Award for the Welfare of the Handicapped
fields.briefDescription: “State Award for the Welfare of the Handicapped” was launched by the Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry. The individuals and institutions are conferred awards on 3rd December every year to encourage them to become economically productive to serve the cause of the Persons with Disability.

fields.schemeName: Horticulture Mission for North Eastern Hill Scheme- Meghalaya
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to improve productivity, quality planting material, canopy management of fruit trees, support marginal and small farmers, upscaling protected cultivation, and drip irrigation.

fields.schemeName: Supply of Sarees and Dhoties to Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: In this scheme, free dhothies and sarees or equivalent Direct Benefit Transfer are provided to the differently abled persons who are benefited under the monthly financial assistance schemes in lieu of Diwali / Pongal / local regional festivals.

fields.schemeName: Post Harvest Marketing Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The “Post Harvest Marketing Scheme” was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya for the creation of post harvest marketing infrastructure.

fields.schemeName: Supply of Prosthetic Appliances to Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Supply of Prosthetic Appliances to Differently Abled Persons” was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. In this scheme, prosthetic appliances are supplied to differently-abled persons free of cost to minimize the mobility challenges experienced by them.

fields.schemeName: Regional Centre for Training and Production of Mushroom
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to train farmers in the method of mushroom cultivation and to supply quality spawn and pasteurized compost to farmers.

fields.schemeName: Agriculture Research Stations and Laboratories Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to conduct adaptive research trials on different crops in the Research Farms and in Farmers' Field for adaptability and use of bio pesticides/bio agents.

fields.schemeName: Bhausaheb Fundkar Falbag Lagvad Scheme
fields.briefDescription: This scheme includes, Plantation of sixteen perennial horticulture crops. Farmer from Konkan division can avail benefit of 0.10 Hector  to 10.00 Hector  and rest Of Maharashtra 0.20 Hector  to 6.00 Hector

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Reimbursement of Educational Expenses to Hearing Impaired Students Pursuing Special Higher Education Courses Inside or Outside the Union Territory of Puducherry
fields.briefDescription: This scheme was introduced by the  Dept of Social Welfare, Govt of Puducherry to provide financial assistance to Hearing Impaired and Visually Impaired students for pursuing their special higher studies. Through this scheme, the reimbursement of the entire fee is granted from the first year onwards.

fields.schemeName: Cash Award to the Meritorious Visually Impaired Students Obtaining First Three Ranks at the State Level in the SSLC and HSC Examination
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to award cash prizes to meritorious differently-abled persons (visually challenged students) who are studying in government and private schools of Puducherry and secure first, second and third rank concerning total marks in the SSLC and HSC exams.

fields.schemeName: "Monthly Grant To Old Crafts Persons (Pension)" Component of the "Development of Handicrafts" Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "Monthly Grant To Old Crafts Persons (Pension)” by the Department of Industries and Commerce, Union Territory of Puducherry, aims to provide pensions to artisans in their old age, recognizing their contribution to traditional crafts. Eligible craftspersons receive a monthly grant of ₹2,000/-.

fields.schemeName: Organic Manure Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide hands on training at the village level on production of organic compost inputs such as compost for plant health management for sustainable agriculture.

fields.schemeName: “Training in Coir” Component of the "Development of Coir" Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Training in Coir” by the Dept of Industries and Commerce, UT of Puducherry aims to promote and develop Coir and Coir-based industries in the region. Additionally, it focuses on providing a 6-month training to the rural poor in producing coir products to generate employment.

fields.schemeName: Agriculture Information Unit Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The key objective is to disseminate information on Scientific methods of cultivation to extension staff and farming community through media such as pamphlets, leaflets, radio, television etc. and participating/holding awareness programs by means of exhibitions, seminars etc.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: National Award For Senior Citizens (Vayoshreshtha Samman): Best District Panchayat In Providing Services And Facilities To Senior Citizens
fields.briefDescription: The "Vayoshreshtha Samman: Best District Panchayat in Providing Services and Facilities to Senior Citizens" award shall be given to the district Panchayats, which have done outstanding work for senior citizens. The awards are conferred on 1st October every year by the Hon’ble President of India.

fields.schemeName: 'Organizing/ Participation in Exhibitions /Trade Fairs /Expo /Seminars /Investors Meets, etc' under 'Marketing And Publicity'
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, Promotion Campaigns, Exhibitions, Trade Fairs, Investors Meets, Seminars etc., are arranged in important towns/cities of India and abroad, to attract industries to invest in Puducherry. This will help them in increasing the marketability of these products.

fields.schemeName: "Entrepreneurship Development Programme" Component of the "Development of Coir" Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide Entrepreneurship training, to encourage prospective entrepreneurs to start the coir industry. Awareness programmes will also be arranged for the existing coir industries about the modern technology and scheme, and incentives available under the State Grant.

fields.schemeName: "Grant to Silk Societies/Agency" Component of the "Development of Silk" Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Grant to Silk Societies/Agency" aims to encourage the silk weaving artisans to form registered societies/agencies to develop a cluster approach among the artisans which is effective and advisable at present for the successful development of their business.

fields.schemeName: "Grant of Margin Money for Availing Capital Loan" Component of the "Development of Coir" Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Grant of Margin Money for Availing Capital Loan" aims to incentivize entrepreneurs to establish new coir industries & revitalise existing ones. The units must be set up in Puducherry. The scheme provides margin money upon receipt of a financial institution's sanction order for a project.

fields.schemeName: The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Allowance to Destitute Women Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Allowance to Destitute Women Scheme” is implemented by the Directorate of Social Welfare, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands to provide financial assistance to the poorest and destitute women in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

fields.schemeName: Sales Rebate under 'Marketing And Publicity'
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide a sales rebate of 15% to the Sales Emporia / Showrooms recognized by the UT of Puducherry for the sale of Handicrafts and micro and small enterprises products manufactured by the units in Puducherry. The objective is to promote the sale of the products of MSMEs.

fields.schemeName: The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Old Age Assistance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The aim of the scheme is to provide social security by way of financial assistance to destitute, senior citizens who are without any means of subsistence and having no one to give financial support to them for their livelihood.

fields.schemeName: Educational Assistance (Scheme for the Pre-Matric and Post-Matric Scholarship to Children of Construction Workers Registered with the MBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides scholarships in the form of financial assistance to children of construction workers registered under the Board. These scholarships will be applicable for courses of study specified by the Board from time to time.

fields.schemeName: Dr. Dharmambal Ammaiyar Ninaivu  Widow Remarriage Assistance Scheme-I
fields.briefDescription: The "Dr. Dharmambal Ammaiyar Ninaivu Widow Remarriage Assistance Scheme" was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme's objective is to encourage widow remarriage and to rehabilitate widows by giving financial assistance.

fields.schemeName: Nirman Shramikon ke Liye Vyavsayik Rin Par Byaj ki Punarbharan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Nirman Shramik Rin Punarbharan Yojana" helps construction workers by reimbursing interest on their business loans. This program aims to ease the financial burden of construction workers by reducing their loan interest payments.

fields.schemeName: Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls-I
fields.briefDescription: "Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls-I" was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Dept, Govt of Tamil Nadu. The scheme provides financial assistance to the orphan girls for their marriage. The bride should be 18 years or older during her marriage.

fields.schemeName: Chief Minister’s Girl Child Protection Scheme-I
fields.briefDescription: The 'Chief Minister’s Girl Child Protection Scheme-I' was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to girl children of poor families as well as to promote girl child education & eradicate female infanticide.

fields.schemeName: Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls-II
fields.briefDescription: "Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls-I" was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Dept, Govt of Tamil Nadu. The scheme provides financial assistance to the orphan girls for their marriage. The bride should be 18 years or older during her marriage.

fields.schemeName: Free Motorized Tricycle Scheme for Persons with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Free Motorized Tricycle Scheme for Persons with Disabilities”, who are facing the mainstream of society due to their disabilities are provided motorized tricycles free of cost to those unable to connect.

fields.schemeName: Petrol Subsidy To Persons With Disability
fields.briefDescription: Under the Petrol Subsidy To Persons With Disability scheme handicapped person using motorized vehicles are entitled to 50% subsidy on actual expenditure on the purchase of petrol/diesel subject to fulfillment of other conditions laid down under the scheme.

fields.schemeName: Shramik Parivahan Yojana (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The registered construction workers will be provided a bus pass through the Municipal Corporation at a concessional rate for commuting from Kadianaka to the workplace.

fields.schemeName: "Employment Incentive" under "Motivation of Entrepreneurs to Start Industries and Fiscal Assistance to Industries"
fields.briefDescription: A Wage/Employment subsidy of 20% of wage/ salary up to a maximum of ₹5,00,000/- per annum is provided in the case of workers who are covered under the Provident Fund (PF). The new units which commence production on or after 2-8-2004 would alone be eligible for this incentive for 5 years.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Sports Development Scheme - Unemployed Young Professional Sportsperson
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 9th February 2024, "Mukhyamantri Sports Development Scheme - Unemployed Young Professional Sportsperson" was launched by the Directorate of Youth Affairs & Sports, Govt. of Tripura. The scheme aims to generate employment opportunities for young experienced professional sportspersons

fields.schemeName: Shree Nanaji Deshmukh Awas Yojana (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: In urban areas, where EWS/LIG houses have been allotted by Local Self-Government Organization/Urban Development Authority & Gujarat Housing Board under Chief Minister/Prime Minister Awas Yojana, the benefit of this scheme is given once per family to construction worker registered in the board.

fields.schemeName: Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Ninaivu Inter-caste Marriage Assistance Scheme-II
fields.briefDescription: The 'Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Ninaivu Inter-caste Marriage Assistance Scheme' was launched by the Social Welfare & Women Empowerment Dept. Tamil Nadu. The aim is to abolish caste & community discrimination by encouraging inter-caste marriage by giving financial assistance to newly married couples.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Vishesh Yogyajan Sammaan Pension Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Mukhyamantri Vishesh Yogyajan Samman Pension Yojana" (MVSYS) stands as a testament to the commitment of the Government of Rajasthan towards the welfare of its citizens, particularly those with disabilities.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Bhagyalaxmi Bond Scheme (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme has been implemented with the objective of "Beti Bachao Beti Padhao" to prevent female foeticide and to meet the education and marriage expenses of the daughter of a construction worker.

fields.schemeName: Vishist Coaching Scheme (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The “Vishist Coaching Scheme” is implemented by Gujarat Building & Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board, Labour, Govt. of Gujarat. Under this scheme, both the registration fee & coaching/tuition fees will be reimbursed/paid for the career development of the children of construction workers.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Vriddhjan Samman Pension Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Rajasthan government's Social Justice and Empowerment Department launched the "Mukhyamantri Vriddhjan Samman Pension Yojana" program, a social welfare initiative that aims to improve the lives of senior citizens residing in the state by providing them with monthly financial assistance.

fields.schemeName: Housing Subsidy Scheme (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The main objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to construction workers registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board to build their own houses.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Assistance Scheme- Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to female workers and the wives of workers to cover expenses incurred for health check-ups, medicine, nutritious diet, etc., during the maternity period.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Extending Family Maintenance Grant to the Families of the Deceased Famous Artists
fields.briefDescription: "Scheme of Extending Family Maintenance Grant to the Families of the Deceased Famous Artists" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The objective of the scheme is to provide a one-time maintenance grant of ₹25,000/- to the families of deceased famous artists.

fields.schemeName: Shramyogi Home Town Scheme- Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to facilitate the payment of railway fares for migrant labourers employed in the organized sector in Gujarat, enabling them to travel to or from their home country to the nearest railway station.

fields.schemeName: Laptop Purchase Assistance Scheme- Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to encourage the children of laborers who are enrolled in professional or design courses by providing assistance for purchasing laptops, thereby reducing the financial burden of education.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Pension Benefits to the Journalists/Photojournalists
fields.briefDescription: "Scheme for Pension Benefits to the Journalists/photojournalists" was launched by the Department of Information and Cultural Affairs, Govt. of Tripura aims to provide financial assistance in the form of a Pension of ₹1000/- to retired Journalists/ photojournalists.

fields.schemeName: Full Medical Checkup Assistance Scheme- Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to conduct health check-ups for male Shramyogis above 45 years of age and female Shram Yogis above 35 years of age who are working in the organized sector in the state of Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: "Green and Eco-Friendly Measures" under “Motivation of Entrepreneurs to Start Industries and Fiscal Assistance to Industries - State Awards to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises”
fields.briefDescription: The award for "Green and Eco-Friendly Measures" is conferred upon the industries that are green and eco-friendly as per the standards of the Department of Science, Technology and Environment (DSTE), Puducherry. The awardee is given a cash award of ₹2,00,000/- and a citation.

fields.schemeName: One Time Cash Incentive towards Learning Driving (Sainik Welfare)
fields.briefDescription: "One Time Cash Incentive towards Learning Driving" is a Welfare Scheme by the Dept of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry. Through this scheme, up to ₹4,000/- is provided to the unemployed Ex-servicemen to learn to drive. The driving course should be taken from a Government-recognized School/Institution.

fields.schemeName: Motivation of Entrepreneurs and Financial Assistance for Rehabilitation of Sick Industries
fields.briefDescription: Through this scheme, the cost of implementing suggestions given by the experts in the field of technology, marketing and finance engaged to advise sick units is reimbursed. 50% subsidy towards the cost of diagnostic study by technical institutions initiated through Financial Institutions/Banks/etc.

fields.schemeName: Thatched House Repair Grant for Re-thatching & Repairs (Sainik Welfare)
fields.briefDescription: Through the "Thatched House Repair Grant for Re-thatching & Repairs" scheme, up to ₹40,000/- is provided to the registered ESM / Widows of ESM / Dependents of ESM every three years, for the re-thatching & repair of their house. The applicant should be receiving a Subsistence Allowance.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Extending Financial Assistance to Folk Artists, Troupes for the Purchase of Musical Instruments, Costumes
fields.briefDescription: "Scheme of Extending Financial Assistance to Folk Artists, Troupes for the Purchase of Musical Instruments, Costumes" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme provides a sum of ₹2,000/- to individual folk artists & ₹6,000/- for cultural troupes.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Encouragement to Young Artists
fields.briefDescription: "Scheme of Encouragement to Young Artists" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Tamil Nadu aims to give a chance to talented young artists to perform in four programs through the successfully running Voluntary Cultural Organization & grant given to the artiste for performing the programs.

fields.schemeName: Mumkin - Livelihood Generation Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "Mumkin - Livelihood Generation Scheme" is a initiative of Jammu & Kashmir State. This scheme is provide the financial help to the youth to empower them and promote the self employment.

fields.schemeName: Diggy
fields.briefDescription: Rajasthan Government has started the Diggy Scheme for the welfare of farmers, under which farmers will be provided grants for making dig for irrigation of crops. This scheme is to help farmers improve their farming by using more water resources and encourage them to grow good crops.

fields.schemeName: Khet Talai
fields.briefDescription: Under the Khet Talai scheme, the Rajasthan Government gives subsidies to the farmers on the construction of farm ponds so that the farmers can collect rainwater and irrigate their fields by making farm ponds in their fields.

fields.schemeName: Dr. P. G. Solanki Scheme for Loan/Assistance to Medical Post Graduate Doctors of Scheduled Caste
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, loans/financial assistance is given to the Scheduled Caste Medical Post Graduate (M.D/M.S) Doctors to start their independent profession, clinic consultation room, etc.

fields.schemeName: Immediate Assistance for Severe Injury in Road/Fire Accident (Sainik Welfare)
fields.briefDescription: "Immediate Assistance for Severe Injury in Road/Fire Accident" is a Welfare Scheme by the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund of the Dept of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry. Through this scheme, ₹25,000/- is provided to the registered Ex-servicemen/Widows of Ex-servicemen who have suffered a Road/Fire Accident.

fields.schemeName: Concession in Railway Travel
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Concession in Railway Travel" was launched by the Dept. of Art & Culture, Tamil Nadu. Under the scheme, individual artists and troupes are allowed to travel in the train on concession by the Railways. A concession certificate will be issued by Mandram.

fields.schemeName: Subsistence Allowance (Sainik Welfare)
fields.briefDescription: "Subsistence Allowance" is a Welfare Scheme by the Dept of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry. The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to the Veterans of the Second World War, Non-pensioners ESM above 60 years under "Below the Poverty Line (BPL)", and their widows.

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Conferring ‘Kalaichemmal’ Awards
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme of Conferring Kalaichemmal Awards" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to encourage eminent artists in the field of paintings and sculptures in recognition of their meritorious service in the fields of Traditional Art and Contemporary Art..........

fields.schemeName: Old Age Pension - Chandigarh
fields.briefDescription: The Old Age Pension scheme aims to provide financial assistance and support to elderly citizens who have reached a certain age and require regular income for their sustenance.

fields.schemeName: Anti Bird Net
fields.briefDescription: Under the Anti Bird Net Birds will never leave your garden if they are used to pecking on certain trees and plants, but if you install anti-bird nets at the appropriate places, you can prevent them from coming again to peck your plants.

fields.schemeName: Grant of Financial Assistance to the School Going Children of Industrial Workers/Employees Studying in 1st to 4th Standard for Supply of One Set of Uniform
fields.briefDescription: "Grant of Financial Assistance to the School-going Children of Industrial Workers/Employees Studying in 1st to 4th Standard for Supply of One Set of Uniform" by the Dept of Labour & Employment, Goa, aims to provide financial assistance for the purchase of uniforms to school-going children.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance Scheme for Purchase of Agricultural Land to Scheduled Caste Farmers
fields.briefDescription: The scheme was launched on in the year 1986. Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to farmers belonging to the scheduled castes to purchase agricultural land, with a maximum limit of 2 acres, for self-cultivation.

fields.schemeName: Advance for Purchase or Construction of House (GBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: "Advance for Purchase or Construction of House" is a Welfare Scheme by the Goa Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Dept of Labour and Employment, Goa. The worker registered with the Board is sanctioned financial assistance of upto ₹50,000 for the purchase/construction of a house.

fields.schemeName: Fodder Minikits under Tribal Area Sub Plan (TASP) Scheme (ST Category)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Fodder Minikits under Tribal Area Sub Plan (TASP) Scheme” is implemented by the Directorate of Animal Husbandry, Government of Gujarat to provide an improved variety of fodder seeds to Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries for widespread publicity, demonstration, and adaptation by farmers.

fields.schemeName: Raja Harishachandra Shramik Mratak Antyeshti Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Government of Uttar Pradesh initiated a scheme "Raja Harishchandra Shramik Mrityu Antim Sanskar Sahayata Yojana" for the financial assistance to the families of deceased workers.

fields.schemeName: Mahadevi Verma Shramik Pustak Kraya Dhan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Mahadevi Verma Shramik Pustak Kraya Dhan Yojana (MVSPKDPY) is a scheme launched by the Uttar Pradesh government in 2022 to provide financial assistance to the daughters of construction workers for purchasing books.

fields.schemeName: HIMAYAT- Deen Dayal Upadhyaya-Grameen Kaushalya Yojana
fields.briefDescription: HIMAYAT is a placement-linked placement-linked market-driven skill training program by the Ministry of Rural Development for the unemployed youth of J&K. The scheme aims at providing entrepreneurial skills for sustainable livelihood to 30,000 youth of J&K and facilitating access to finance.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Power Driven Chaff Cutter Scheme under Integrated Fodder Development Scheme (General Category)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to dairy farmers belonging to General Caste category on purchase of electric powered chaff cutters. By using power driven chaff cutter, dairy farmers can reduce wastage of green & dry fodder which is economically important for their profitable dairy farming.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Power Driven Chaff Cutter Scheme under Scheduled Castes Sub Plan (SC Category)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to dairy farmers belonging to Scheduled Caste category on purchase of electric powered chaff cutters. By using power driven chaff cutter, dairy farmers can reduce wastage of green &dry fodder which is economically important for their profitable dairy farming.

fields.schemeName: Poompuhar District Craft Award
fields.briefDescription: "Poompuhar District Craft Award" was launched in 2011-2012 by the Dept of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi, Tamil Nadu. The award was introduced to recognize and honour the artisans district-wise. This award consists of a cash prize of ₹10,000/-, a silver medal, and a certificate.

fields.schemeName: Team Production Award
fields.briefDescription: The "Team Production Award" scheme was launched by the Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles, & Khadi Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. This award is being given to artisans for handicraft items to be made by a team. This award will be given to 3 groups every year with a cash prize etc.....

fields.schemeName: Gen Next Competition
fields.briefDescription: The "Gen Next Competition" scheme was launched by the Department of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. A craft competition was started from the year 2013-2014 to encourage the youth to retain the traditional handicrafts of Tamil Nadu & pass them on to the next generation.

fields.schemeName: Aaws Bhatta Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The Aaws Bhatta Sahaayata Yojana Government of Madhya Pradesh runs this scheme for those poor students belonging to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe of its state whose college is very far from their house and they have to rent accommodation near the college to study.
